articles.description: NASA’s Webb telescope uncovers mysterious "little red dots," pointing to the existence and growth of supermassive black holes.
articles.content: Less than six months after beginning its science operations, the Webb Telescope (JWST) unveiled numerous red objects in the sky that puzzled scientists. These objects, initially dubbed “little red do… [+5320 chars]

articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: The tiniest, most isolated galaxies grow unstoppably - Big Think
articles.description: Scientists just viewed one of the tiniest, most isolated, lowest-mass galaxies ever found with JWST. Despite all odds, it's still growing.

articles.author: Frontiers
articles.title: Curious blue rings in trees and shrubs reveal cold summers of the past—potentially caused by volcanic eruptions - Phys.org
articles.description: Trees need a certain number of warm days in their growing seasons to grow properly; otherwise, the cell walls of new growth don't lignify properly, creating blue rings that appear when wood samples are dyed.
